intro: Mouriri cearensis subsp. carajasica, commonly known as the Carajás mouriri, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Brazilian states of Pará and Maranhão, where it thrives in humid, tropical environments. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It produces elliptical, woody fruits that contain several seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
